instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: How to replace <CHIP>TPS22924</CHIP>
threads.message: Do you replace <CHIP>TPS22924</CHIP> from donor board or only new as they are bga chip?

threads.title: How to replace <CHIP>TPS22924</CHIP>
threads.message:
Only new because rebelling a $1 chip is not worth the time it takes to reball manually 
​​

threads.title: How to replace <CHIP>TPS22924</CHIP>
threads.message: I put the balls on the board and clean the chip.

threads.title: How to replace <CHIP>TPS22924</CHIP>
threads.message: Whatever balls fit. I think I use .3 or .35
